intro: Cochlearia pyrenaica var. borzaeana, commonly known as the Pyrenean cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to harsh, alpine environments. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
